data.title: When opening a replay with an unknown map, make the client identify and/or offer downloading from the resource center.
data.body: The error message could tell you the map's resource site map ID and perhaps even offer up a link to it or offer up a direct download.

data.title: [Replay] Missing requiered maps should be auto downloaded... or embedded
data.body:
When i want to watch a replay... an the map is missing but the map is in the resource center ... the map should be downloaded by the game instead of showing the map-hash :/

Or allow an option to embedded a map in a replay on custom maps the game could remove the "MAP-DATABLOCK" after extracting them :/

data.title: Expose separate middle and right mouse scroll config.
data.body: Fixes #9399 and cleans up some labeling inconsistencies in the Input settings panel.

data.title: Enable group-unit-selection for spectators.

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body: This should, in theory, fix #9492.  The spectator and selection code is a bit horrible, so I'm not confident that this covers all the edge cases that we care about and/or is the best approach.

data.title: Preserve editor actor ordering.
data.body: Fixes #11125 which happens because parsing the map actor definitions into a `Dictionary` was throwing away their ordering, which matters for spawn points.

data.title: Increase ambient light level in Fort Lonestar and GDI06.
data.body:
Fort Lonestar being too dark is a common complaint that i've seen in game streams and other channels.  This bumps the light levels a bit in Lonestar and GDI06 to help improve this situation without affecting the ambient feeling _too_ much.

Fixes #9939.

data.title: Generate frozen actor renderables for all map-placed actors.
data.body: Fixes #11080.  This is a rather obvious polish bug in the current playtest, so if there are no objections I would like to see this included in the next playtest.

data.title: [RA] The official map pool. Altering existing maps, part 2
data.body:
After #10718 I'm extending the alter list into a new issue.

**Forum collaboration thread** 
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=294875#294875

Separate issues will eventually be submitted for each map for a final review and chance for additional discussion.

Map and author names should stay unchanged unless the map is altered a lot beyond it's original structure.

data.title: Add support for playing a "LoseNotification" to the old owner through CaptureNotification
data.body:
We want this for at least ra2: https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/pull/187#discussion_r59159963

The default being `null` won't cause trouble as `PlayNotification` already catches that.

data.title: Removed redundant targetPassedBy check.
data.body: This is probably a copy & paste mistake as you can see the identical block a few lines below in another conditional. In line 599 the whole block is already checking against `targetPassedBy` so Coverity is right that it can never be true and therefore only introduces dead code.

data.title: Fixed NullReferenceExceptions if package opening fails.
data.body: `OpenPackage` explicitly returns null if the file suffixes don't match .zip or .oramap, which I assume doesn't happen very often in practice, but Coverity is right, that this should not crash here.

data.title: Fixed NullReferenceExceptions in UpgradeRules
data.body: `parent` can be null according to Coverity and our experience.

data.title: Made XccGlobalDatabase disposable
data.body: Coverity complained that it isn't and can leak resources if problems occur.

data.title: Removed unnecessary null checks in CheckTargetHealthRadius
data.body: Coverity complained that this leaves logically dead code while assigning `targetExtraSearchRadius`. It will never hit the `WDist.Zero` case.

data.title: Added music controlling hotkeys.
data.body:
You can change them in options, by default it is set to audio keys.
Resolves?: #3231

data.title: Fix PixelDoubling not working properly after zooming with mousewheel
data.body: I decided to write it this way (instead of setting `Game.Settings.Graphics.PixelDouble` in `Viewport.Zoom` appropriately) because I see the double pixel setting as the user's preference that the game uses at the start of a match and which should not be changed only because the user decided to zoom in a bit.

data.title: Buildable range indicator Cycle turns Red when placing Buildings.
data.body:
I mean not the footprint!

In Cnc when placing Buildings while you have selected the construction Yard, the white range Indicator turns red when placing a building and turns back to white which is senseless. It could be stay white or shortly hidden.

Yes i know for what the range indicator is but it would be make more sense that the indicator turns red when the Player is trying to place a structure outside the buildable range...

it would be also make more sense to toggle the indicator on or off by hotkey to show my buildable range

Reproduce case:
1. start a cnc match and undeploy your MCV
2. Select the construction yard and build a structure (while leaving the construction yard  selected)
3. place it... the white cycle turns to red and after 2 Seconds back to white...

data.title: Investigate Snap packaging for Ubuntu 16.04.
data.body:
Ubuntu 16.04 adds support for snap packages that can be uploaded to and distributed via the Ubuntu software center.  This should, in principle, provide a much better install experience for people on the new Ubuntu.

I'm planning to investigate what we need to support this for our next release.

data.title: [bleed/prep] Left-click orders: unable to select new unit while another is already selected
Fix the spyplane not having a tooltip ingame
data.body: Fixes #11128.

data.title: Add hotkeys for save areas of the map
data.body: Closes #2956 Add hotkeys for save areas of the map, and hotkeys for jump to saved positions

data.title: You can now add and remove orders from RejectsOrders
data.body: Closes #10978

data.title: Spy Plane has no name tag
data.body:
Hey guys, noticed on christmass release, the Spy PLane itself has no name describing it ingame.

![spyplane](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/14582466/f9b3274e-0405-11e6-832d-88e1830e22d4.png)

data.title: 20160403 Playtest: Ctrl-zooming bug
data.body: Using the ctrl-zooming option (or whatever key it's mapped to) doesn't correctly update the cursor. It seems like it doesn't properly track if you zoomed in or out, because zooming in this way causes the pixel doubling hotkey to try to zoom in again (only updating the cursor in the process).

data.title: 20160403 Playtest: Left-click control issues
data.body:
Although the release notes state that "a couple of issues related to left-click controls have been solved", it actually feels more broken than before.

A couple of issues that I've noticed in Tiberian Dawn (haven't tested other mods):
- Attack orders do not work at all. This includes ordering Harvesters to harvest specific patches of Tiberium and ordering vehicles onto the Repair Bay.
- Left clicking the minimap does nothing and seems to instead issue clicks behind it (like being able to select units hidden by the minimap).

data.title: Map editor regularly scrambles player positions.
data.body:
I think this is somewhat important. When you place the player spawns in your editor, the map seldom saves them in the order that you placed them. The letter-positions gets to be random. This is why most maps often look like 

this
![engagement orig](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/14581528/aee3867a-03ef-11e6-80a3-66bfd56957a5.png)

instead of this
![engagement rew](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/14581530/b23dd302-03ef-11e6-8dc7-11b9103ec719.png)

*edit: the bug seem to appear when editing existing maps, removing and re-placing player spawns. In  order to reproduce the bug with a new map you need to save it, exit the editor, re-open the map and replace the player spawns with new player spawns.

The scrambling sort of defeats the purpose of having lettered positions in the lobby. In the editor I'm currently solving this by placing player spawns one by one,  _save and quit the map_ and reopen the map after each one,  until I have them all there.

data.title: Add tileset depth metadata support.
data.body:
This adds support for per-tile Z-ramp and Z-offsets to the tileset code and gen2 tileset importer.  The TS tilesets are reimported with proper values.

The defaults are set up so that tiles without any extra depth metadata will be "flat" at ground level  the test commit enables this in RA for illustration.  The TS tilesets are set up so that tile tile depths are correctly zeroed at the middle of the tile.

The expected behaviour is (for mods with `EnableDepth: true`) for sprite data to be cut off for all y < CenterPosition.Y, because for flat sprites with Z = CenterPosition.Z anything lower is rendered behind the terrain.  A future PR that adds support for sprite depth maps will fix that.  This puts the ground work in place by setting the correct terrain depth.

data.title: [TS] Destroyable Roads via Ice layer logic?
data.body:
In TS we have Paved roads with destroyed Ends maybe we can enable it to destroy paved roads.
For example when a cluster missile Explodes on them :) So the buildings and Roads gets destroyed.

We could attach an ICE Layer logic to Road to give them the ability... to get destroyable :)

data.title: Move Render traits to Traits.Render namespace
data.body:
Sort of follow-up to #11097 and #11017.

While most render traits follow a relatively consistent naming scheme, this still makes it easier to tell them apart from other trait categories in the wiki (and presumably some dev GUIs).

data.title: Selecting default mod when launching
data.body: Right now, the last mod is launched when you start the game for the next time. The modchooser should have a setting where you can select the default mod.
